ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Packaged_part is a type of a . A Packaged_part may be a or a , or additionally may be an . A Packaged_part describes a part that exists independently from any particular assembly on which it may be used. The Packaged_part Application object does not indicate that a product used as a component is in a particular product category. A Packaged_part sometimes is realized by installing one or more occurrences of into a , bonding conductors between appropriate ports on the occurrence of the and on the , filling the void between the occurrences of the and the with an insulating potting material, and marking the realization with an identifier. See Figure for an illustration of a cutaway view of a Packaged_part. Two Packaged_part models may be exchanged with this part of ISO 10303, depending on usage. One may support the exchange information that maps the functionality of the Packaged_part to the , or dies, included in the Packaged_part; and information that maps the terminals of those instances of to the terminals of the Packaged_part. This mechanism provides maximum flexibility and information exchange and is characterized as a "white box" model. This model is primarily included in the standard to support design to analysis activities. Alternatively, one may map the functionality required directly to the Packaged_part terminals, and not populate the . This is simpler, but does not provide as much information and is characterized as the "black box" model.

the access_mechanisms is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Packaged_part is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Packaged_part as its associated_definition. There shall be zero or more Packaged_part_terminal for a Packaged_part.

the implemented_function specifies the role of the for the Packaged_part. The function specified shall be that mapped by the functional view terminal to physical view terminal allocation requirement. The implemented_function need not be specified for a particular Packaged_part unless the access_mechanisms is not an empty set.

the potting_compound specifies the that is used to support the enclosed in the Packaged_part. The potting_compound need not be specified for a particular Packaged_part. The potting_compound may form the itself for some technologies when the is molded from the potting_compound.
the used_package specifies the of the Packaged_part. There shall be one or more used_package for a Packaged_part.

A Packaged_part_join_terminal is a type of such that an occurrence of the Packaged_part_terminal shall not be in the role of an external interface when the occurrence of the associated is a component in an assembly.
A Packaged_part_terminal is a type of that describes a terminal of a . A Packaged_part_terminal may be one of a or a .
the associated_definition specifies the that has the Packaged_part_terminal.

the terminal_of_package specifies the for the Packaged_part_terminal. The terminal_of_package specifies the role of either the or the for the Packaged_part_terminal. There shall be one or more for each terminal_of_package. If there is more than one terminal_of_package then the member reference different members.
